item.description: Chapter 1 The Right Problem Defining the problem was about ninety percent of the battle Multipass Algorithms These algorithms make several passes over the input data and make little progress each time A time space tradeoff and one that isn’t Programming folklore and theory abound with time-space tradeoffs: by using more time a programming can run in less space. It has been my experience more frequently, though, that reducing a program’s space requirements also reduce it’s run time
